page.title: 11COMMUNICATION DOWNLAND
page.content: Many roads or tracks cross the area linking the villages and the market town, Marlborough. They are mainly ancient in origin, and are mostly unmetalled or soon cease to be made up. 1. Part of the Roman road from Corinium to Cunetio rauns S. from Ogbourne St. George towards Minal. 2. Part of harepath from Liddington Castle and the Ridgeway runs SSW towards Marlborough. It joins the Marlborough/Minal road at the confluence of the Og and athe Kennet S. of the area. 3. Track leading from the harepathSSE to Ramsbury. 4. Aldbaourne SW to Marlborough via Stock Lane, Red Lane and harepath(2). 5. From Ramsbury, W. through Sound Bottom and Dean Lane to Marlborough via 4 and 3, or to Ogbourne St. Andrew via old Coach Road. Other tracks and paths form a network between those listed.
